channel.title: [SOLVED]Cronjob not working in Workstation
channel.description:
On a Qubes 3.1 in the standard anon-whonix Workstation I had difficulties getting cronjob working. After a restart attemp with [code]sudo /etc/init.d/cron start[/code] that indicated a succesfull start of cron, however [code]sudo service --status-all[/code] indicated that cron was not running.
Not sure if this problem is a qubes-whonix specifc problem or all Whonix versions. If more info is needed for solving this problem, feel free to ask! How could cron/cronjob be activated when [code]sudo /etc/init.d/cron start[/code] seems to be ignored?

I think it’s not related to security too. just “unnecessary services…”.
As Marek said, it’s about “performance”.

Qubes is based on Fedora, and anacron is the only offered cron. Unlike Debian, Fedora don’t have choice for cron daemon.
